title: Should the Faroe Islands be considered a part of the British Isles? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, I don’t think they should. Firstly they are an autonomous part of the Kingdom of Denmark and therefore not a part of Britain.Secondly, and more importantly in this context, they sit on a different continental shelf than the British Islands. That said, I think there is a fairly strong connection between the regions/people, as Irish monks probably were the first to settle the islands, and also the islands were occupied by British troops during WWII where they for example recognized the Faroese flag (Merkið) as the civil ensign of the Faroe Islands and thus contributing to the strong national identity of the faroese people. There is also a fair amount of offspring from the many romantic relationships between british soldiers and faroese ladies, that would occur during the 5–6 year occupation, so the familiar bonds are relatively strong too. Rockall Bank dispute - Wikipedia British occupation of the Faroe Islands - Wikipedia
